660.03
1486.01   PURPOSE.
   It is the intent of this chapter to provide uniform and rational signage
regulations that are complementary with the community’s existing character and
support economic development and vitality throughout the area.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94; Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.02   OBJECTIVES.
   The objectives of this chapter are to:
   (a)   Uphold the planning efforts and initiatives as set forth by the
Ellwood City Borough among its residential, industrial and commercial areas.
   (b)   Promote the economic prosperity of the Ellwood City Borough’s
commercial areas through the flexible and practical signage regulation.
   (c)   Ensure public safety by regulating signage standards so as not to
cause distraction or impede the ability for motor vehicles to travel safely
throughout the Borough.
   (d)   To preserve the existing character of Ellwood City Borough’s
commercial area while supporting clear yet innovative and creative forms of
conveying information.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.03   DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   “Animation.” The movement or change of lighting to depict action or
create a special effect or scene in a sign.
   (b)   “Back-Lit Illumination.” A means of illuminating a sign whose
structure is mounted to the wall of a building and contains space between the
structure and the wall itself, by locating lights behind the structure which
shine onto the wall of the building, illuminating the sign from behind.
   (c)   “Bed and Breakfast.” A single-family, owner-occupied dwelling, where
between one and six sleeping accommodations are rented to overnight guests on a
daily basis for periods not exceeding two weeks. Breakfast may be offered only
to registered overnight guests.
   (d)   “Changeable Copy.” A sign or portion thereof on which the copy or
symbols change automatically through electronical means or manually through the
secure placement of letters or symbols.
   (e)   “Civic-Oriented Use.” An area developed or to be developed that may
contain one of the following public buildings or uses, including offices,
libraries, playgrounds, parks, assembly halls, or first responder stations.
   (f)   “Copy.” The words and/or graphics to be printed or displayed.
   (g)   “Digital Display.” The portion of a sign message made up on internally
illuminated components capable of changing the message periodically. Digital
displays may include LED illumination or similar features of illumination.
   (h)   “External Illumination.” A means of illuminating a sign by lighting
devices not located within the sign itself, but may or may not be attached to
the sign, such as gooseneck lights, panel lights, and flood lights.
   (i)   “Face.” The area or portion of a sign on which copy is intended to be
placed.
   (j)   “Funeral Home.” Establishments engaged in undertaking services such as
preparing the dead for burial and arranging and managing funerals.
   (k)   “Graphic Area.” The area of the square or rectangle that would
completely enclose all parts of the sign copy and any decorative background.
The supporting canopy or awning shall not be included in the calculation of
graphic area, except where there is a change of color or material which forms a
background for the sign copy.
    (l)   “Ground Floor.” The space that is contained within the floor of the
building base, which is on the same level as the sidewalk located in front of
the front facade of the building, and extends upwards to the bottom of the
floor of the space located directly above. The second floor behinds at the top
of its floor.
   (m)   “Internal Illumination.” A means of illuminating a sign internally by
locating a light source within the sign that allows for light to project
through the transparent material of the sign but not through the opaque
material of the sign.
   (n)   “Internally Illuminated Lettering.” A source of sign illumination
which refers to the illumination of individual letters whose faces are covered
and are independently mounted within a wall sign that allow for light to pass
through the transparent material used on the face of the letter.
   (o)   “LED Illumination.” A method of illuminating a sign by incorporating
LED lights that may or may not change in pattern and/or message.
   (p)   “Neon/Tube Illumination.” A method of illuminating a sign by
incorporating neon tubing which illuminates internally.
   (q)   “Place of Assembly/Worship.” An institution and/or lot that is
designed for the assembly or collection of persons, for civic, political,
educational, social or religious purposes, and where recreation, amusement,
dining, or religious worship may occur as accessory activities. A place of
assembly does not include a private club.
   (r)   “Public Property.” Any lot owned by a municipal, county, State or
Federal entity or division.
   (s)   “Sign Area.” The entirety of the sign structure, which includes the
sign copy, graphics, illustration, background structure and support structure.
   (t)   “Sign.” Any structure, device, light or natural object, including the
ground itself, or any part thereof or any device attached thereto or painted or
represented thereon, which shall be used to identify, advertise or attract
attention to any object, product, place, activity, person, institution,
organization, firm, group, commodity, profession, enterprise, industry or
business, or which shall display or include any letter, word, model, number,
banner, flag, pennant, insignia, device or representation used as an
announcement, direction or advertisement, and which is intended to be seen from
off the premises or from a parking lot. “Sign” shall include the structure
which supports the sign face, as well as the sign face itself. “Sign” shall not
include signs which are affixed to the inside of windows and glass doors of
enclosed buildings, except for illuminated or animated show windows. No other
indoor sign shall be deemed a sign under this chapter.
      (1)   “Air-Activated Sign.” A temporary sign made of polyamide nylon silk
or similar materials which is inflated by air by means of a motorized blower.
Also known as an “air dancer” sign.
      (2)   “Address/Directory/Wayfinding Sign.” A permanent sign whose purpose
is to assist the public in navigating the public realm.
      (3)   “Awning Sign.” A permanent sign that is mounted, painted, or
otherwise applied on or attached to an awning structure and which may include
separate graphic areas on each of the awning structure’s faces.
      (4)   “Banner Sign.” A temporary sign having characters, letters or
illustrations applied to cloth, canvas or other type of natural or man-made
fabric.
      (5)   “Billboard Sign.” A sign advertising goods or services not produced
or available on the premises containing the sign.
      (6)   “Blade Sign.” A temporary sign composed of fabric such as polyknit,
nylon, or similar material, which is attached to a pole no greater than two
inches in diameter and is usually inserted into the ground or mounted by a
removable stabilization structure placed directly on the ground.
      (7)   “Building Directory Sign.” A permanent sign which is located inside
a building or within the building’s portico which displays the names and
locations of the tenants of a multi-tenant site. A building directory sign is
not located on a surface of a building wall that abuts the public right-of-way.
      (8)   “Building Sign.” A permanent sign which displays the name of the
building upon which the sign is erected/installed.
      (9)   “Canopy Sign.” A permanent sign that is mounted, painted, or
otherwise applied on or attached to a canopy structure and which may include
separate graphic areas on each of the canopy structure’s faces.
      (10)   “Construction Sign.” A sign located on property on which there is
construction and/or development.
      (11)   “Contractor Sign.” A sign located on a property upon which a
contractor is making improvements and/or renovations to the property’s building
or structure.
      (12)   “Dedication Sign.” A permanent sign located on a building or
structure which displays that a sponsoring body is associated with that
building or structure.
      (13)   “Directional Sign.” A permanent sign located upon the same lot as
its business establishment which indicates the ingress and egress points in
order to guide the circulation of motorists and pedestrians to and on the site.
      (14)   “Double-Faced Sign.” A sign which displays text, shapes and/or
symbols on both sides the object. The term “Double-Faced Sign” applies to pole
signs, sandwich board signs, ground signs, real estate signs, pylon signs,
multiple-business signs and projecting signs.
      (15)   “Flag Sign.” A piece of fabric or other flexible material attached
to or designed to be flown from a pole or similar device that is affixed to a
building or the ground.
      (16)   “Free-Standing Sign.” A sign supported entirely by its own
structure set in or on the ground and not attached to a building or other
structure. The height of a free-standing sign shall be measured from the
average grade at the bottom of the sign to the top of the sign. Freestanding
signs should not overhang the sidewalk or project into the right-of-way.
      (17)   “Ground Sign.” A permanent freestanding sign suspended or
supported by one or more braces anchored in the ground The sign area shall
include the structure upon which the displayed message is located.
      (18)   “Hanging Sign.” A permanent sign attached to a building or
structure that hangs parallel from the wall or structure to which it is
attached.
      (19)   “Identification Sign.” A permanent type of sign which is located
upon the same lot as a business establishment whose purpose is to make the
location and presence of the business establishment known to the public.
      (20)   “Incidental Sign.” A permanent sign which may or may not be
permanently displayable upon the exterior surface(s) of the business
establishment or upon the business establishment’s lot that conveys pertinent
information to the public such as local events, specials, or a restaurant menu.
An incidental sign may be located on the same structure as a secondary
component to a business identification sign. Interior window signs, such as
open signs, event flyers, “help wanted” signs, and displays of business hours,
are not covered by incidental sign guidelines. The single stipulation for
interior window signs directed to the exterior is that in aggregate, they may
not cover more than 40% of window area.
      (21)   “Information Sign.” A permanent group of signs whose purpose is to
convey general information to the general public about the subject lot but
which may or may not be associated with identification or wayfinding matters of
said lot.
      (22)   “Interpretive Sign.” A permanent sign which is not associated with
the business establishment upon which the sign is located, but which conveys
that an organization or institute, such as the “Western Pennsylvania
Conservancy maintains a portion of this lot.”
      (23)   “Marquee Sign.” A permanent sign mounted on a permanent, roofed
structure attached and supported by the building which projects over the public
right-of-way, but is not attached to the public right-of-way.
      (24)   “Multiple-Business Sign.” A permanent sign mounted at or near the
ingress/egress point of a lot containing multiple business establishments which
displays the different business establishments contained within the lot.
      (25)   “Nonconforming Sign.” Any sign which exists on the effective date
of this chapter and does not comply with the requirements of this chapter.
      (26)   “Pennant Sign.” A temporary sign in which individual pennants are
secured to a fabric or vinyl string.
      (27)   “Permanent Sign.” A sign intended to be erected or used for a time
period in excess of 30 days which advertises the location of a business
establishment.
      (28)   “Pole Sign.” A permanent freestanding sign that is affixed,
attached, or erected on a pole that is not itself an integral part of or
attached to a building or structure. The pole itself shall not be calculated in
the dimensions of the sign area.
      (29)   “Political Sign.” A sign which announces or advocates any
candidate for political office or a ballot question. See: “Yard Sign.”
      (30)   “Projecting Sign.” A sign attached to a building wall along one
edge of the sign, or attached to a wall by a bracket perpendicular to the wall
surface.
      (31)   “Pylon Sign.” A permanent freestanding sign in excess of eight
feet in height that is detached from a building and is supported by one or more
structural elements which are architecturally similar to the design of the
sign.
      (32)   “Real Estate Sign.” A temporary sign that relates to the sale,
lease, or rental of property or buildings.
      (33)   “Roof Sign.” A sign erected on a roof or a sign that projects
above the highest point of the roofline, parapet or facade of the building.
      (34)   “Sculptural Feature Sign.” A permanent three-dimensional
sculptural feature resting on or attached to the ground and which may hold a
sign. The feature is permitted with or without wording and may be either mobile
(temporary) or immobile (permanent).
      (35)   “Street Address Sign.” A permanent sign identifying the street
numbers and/or street name, whether used for emergency and/or delivery
purposes, associated with the lot. A street address sign may be located on the
window of a business establishment but shall not be considered a window sign.
      (36)   “Wall Sign.” A permanent sign attached to a building’s wall.
      (37)   “Window Sign.” A permanent sign that is painted, suspended, or
otherwise applied on or attached to a window or door window, but which does not
include a street address sign.
      (38)   “Yard Sign.” A temporary H-frame or I-frame sign affixed to the
ground that is used for conveying advertising, political information or other
messaging and which shall include construction signs, contractor signs, real
estate signs, political signs and the like.
   (u)   “Street Frontage.” A property line which abuts a public right-of-way
that provides public access to or visibility to the premises.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94; Ord. 2221. Passed 12-15-97; Ord. 2534. Passed 5-
15-17.)
1486.04   COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   Any sign hereafter established or maintained shall conform to the provisions
of this chapter. Applicable signs are those hereby defined by Section
1486.03 of this chapter.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94; Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.05   AUTHORITY.
   The Borough reserves the right to regulate signs within the municipality as
set forth by this chapter.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.06   SIGN REGULATIONS.
   The following chart, Chart A: Signage Regulations, organizes the permitted
signage types by zoning district and indicates permitted size, changeable copy
regulations and illumination standards for each sign within the various zoning
districts. Signs which are not permitted are indicated by a void space. These
standards are also translated into provisions which can be found on the
following pages. See Chart A: Signage Regulations. (Chart A can be found
attached to Ordinance 2534. A copy of this ordinance is available in the
offices of the Borough for public inspection during normal business hours.) The
following regulations dictate the size of signs, the permitted copy and
illumination standards within each zoning district denotes supplementary
standards where applicable. For examples of these signs, please see: Ellwood
City Borough Signage Reference Manual. All zoning district references are
related to the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance and Official Zoning Map,
as amended. If any conflicts or discrepancies between this chapter and the
Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance exist, the regulation and/or provision of
the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance shall apply and the regulation and/or
provision of this chapter shall be deemed null.
   (a)   Permanent Signs.
      (1)   Awning Sign. (See also: Ellwood City Borough Signage Reference
Manual).
         A.   C-1 Local Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The sign area (in square feet) of awning signs shall be
equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         B.   C-2 Downtown Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         C.   C-3 Gateway North District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         D.   C-3 Core Commercial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         E.   C-3 Gateway West District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         F.   C-3 Institutional–Professional District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall not be
permitted.
         G.   I Industrial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than the linear width of the building frontage.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall only be
through external illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         H.   Residential Districts (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Permitted Land Uses: Awning signs shall only be permitted for
the following land uses:
               a.   Funeral homes
               b.   Places of assembly/worship
               c.   Bed and breakfasts
            2.   Size: The graphic area (in square feet) of awning signs shall
be equal to or less than one-fourth of the linear width of the building
frontage.
            3.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for awning signs shall not be
permitted.
            4.   Illumination: The illumination of awning signs shall not be
permitted.
      (2)   Billboard Sign. (See also: Ellwood City Borough Signage Reference
Manual).
         A.   C-1 Local Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance): not permitted.
         B.   C-2 Downtown Commercial District (see also Section

      (3)   Blade Sign. (See also: Ellwood City Borough Signage Reference
Manual).
         A.   General Regulations.
            1.   Blade signs shall be spaced at least 15 feet apart from each
other.
            2.   Blade signs shall be replaced every four months or less unless
otherwise approved by the Building Inspector.
         B.   District Regulations.
            1.   C-1 Local Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance): not permitted.

be permitted.

permitted.

      (10)   Ground Sign. (See also: Ellwood City Borough Signage Reference
Manual).
         A.   C-1 Local Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area of ground signs shall not exceed 60
square feet and shall not exceed six feet in height.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for ground signs shall be
permitted for civic-oriented uses, funeral homes and places of assembly/
worship, as defined by this chapter. Changeable copy for the ground signs for
all other land uses shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of ground shall only be through
external illumination, back-lit illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         B.   C-2 Downtown Commercial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance): not permitted.
         C.   C-3 Gateway North District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area of ground signs shall not exceed 60
square feet and shall not exceed six feet in height.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for ground signs shall be
permitted for civic-oriented uses, funeral homes and places of assembly/
worship, as defined by this chapter. Changeable copy for the ground signs for
all other land uses shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of ground shall only be through
external illumination, back-lit illumination or no illumination whatsoever.
         D.   C-3 Core Commercial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance): not permitted.
         E.   C-3 Gateway West District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area of ground signs shall not exceed 60
square feet and the sign itself shall not exceed six feet in height.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for ground signs shall be
permitted for civic-oriented uses, funeral homes and places of assembly/
worship, as defined by this chapter. Changeable copy for the ground signs for
all other land uses shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of ground signs shall only be
through external illumination, back-tit illumination or no illumination
whatsoever.
         F.   C-3 Institutional–Professional District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area of ground signs shall not exceed 24
square feet and shall not exceed four feet in height.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for ground signs shall be
permitted for civic-oriented uses, funeral homes and places of assembly/
worship, as defined by this chapter. Changeable copy for the ground signs for
all other land uses shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of wall signs shall only be
through external illumination, backlit illumination, or no illumination
whatsoever.
         G.   I Industrial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The graphic area of ground signs shall not exceed 60
square feet and shall not exceed six feet in height.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for ground signs shall be
permitted for civic-oriented uses, funeral homes and places of assembly/
worship, as defined by this chapter. Changeable copy for the ground signs for

            3.   Illumination: The illumination of ground shall only be through

eight inches in height and 36 inches in length or as otherwise specified by the
Lawrence County Zoning Ordinance, as amended.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for street address signs
shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of street address signs shall
not be permitted.
         G.   I Industrial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The sign area of street address signs shall not exceed
eight inches in height and 36 inches in length or as otherwise specified by the
Lawrence County Zoning Ordinance, as amended.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for street address signs
shall not be permitted.
            3.   Illumination: The illumination of street address signs shall
not be permitted.
         H.   Residential Districts (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
            1.   Size: The sign area of street address signs shall not exceed
eight inches in height and 36 inches in length or as otherwise specified by the
Lawrence County Zoning Ordinance, as amended.
            2.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for street address signs

            3.   Illumination: The illumination of street address signs shall

      (24)   Window Sign (Ground Floor/Non-Ground Floor). (See also: Ellwood

      (2)   Banner Sign. (See also: Ellwood City Borough Signage Reference
Manual).
         A.   General Regulations.
            1.   Banner signs shall only be permitted to be erected on lots
used for any of the following land uses:
               a.   Civic-oriented use.
               b.   Cultural and recreation services.
               c.   Place of worship/place of assembly.
               d.   School.
            2.   The total number of days within a calendar year that a banner
sign or a combination of banner signs may be erected on a lot shall not exceed
120 days, unless a permit is successfully renewed through the Building
Inspector.
            3.   Banner signs shall be located within the front yard setback or
securely mounted or attached to the front facade of the building upon which it
is located, but shall not be located in the public right-of-way.
         B.   District Regulations.
            1.   C-1 Local Business District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Banner signs may be externally illuminated if
it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the permit application
that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to public safety or the
surrounding residential area. If not approved by the Building Inspector, no
illumination shall be permitted for the banner sign.
            2.   C-2 Downtown Commercial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Banner signs may be externally illuminated if
it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the permit application
that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to public safety or the
surrounding residential area. If not approved by the Building Inspector, no
illumination shall be permitted for the banner sign.
            3.   C-3 Gateway North District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Banner signs may be externally illuminated if
it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the permit application
that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to public safety or the
surrounding residential area. If not approved by the Building Inspector, no
illumination shall be permitted for the banner sign.
            4.   C-3 Core Commercial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Illumination: Banner signs may be externally
illuminated if it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the
permit application that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to
public safety or the surrounding residential area. If not approved by the
Building Inspector, no illumination shall be permitted for the banner sign.
            5.   C-3 Gateway West District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Illumination: Banner signs may be externally
illuminated if it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the
permit application that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to
public safety or the surrounding residential area. If not approved by the
Building Inspector, no illumination shall be permitted for the banner sign.
            6.   C-3 Institutional–Professional District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Illumination: Banner signs may be externally
illuminated if it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the
permit application that the illumination shall not cause negative impact to
public safety or the surrounding residential area. If not approved by the

            7.   I Industrial District (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
               a.   Size: The graphic area of banner signs shall not exceed 50
square feet.
               b.   Copy: The use of changeable copy for banner signs shall not
be permitted.
               c.   Illumination: Illumination: Banner signs may be externally
illuminated if it can be demonstrated to the Building Inspector through the

public safety or the surrounding residential area. If not approved by the

            8.   Residential Districts (see also Section
1266.04 of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance): not permitted.

1486.07   SIGN ALLOCATION.
   The following chart, Chart B: Signage Allocation, organizes the allocation
of permitted signs within the various zoning districts. (Chart B can be found
attached to Ordinance 2534. A copy of this ordinance is available in the
offices of the Borough for public inspection during normal business hours.)
These allocations regulations are also translated into provisions which can be
found on the following pages.
   The following provisions describe the permissible allocation of signage
types within the applicable zoning districts. Any lot and its accompanying
business establishments are able to erect fewer than the permissible number of
signs.
   (a)   C-1 Local Business District. (See also Section
1266.04  of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
      (1)   Within the C-1 Local Business District, a ground-floor business
establishment may have:
         A.   One of the following: wall sign, awning sign, combination of wall
sign and awning sign, or marquee sign; and
         B.   Window signs whose coverage do not exceed 15% of the total window
area on the floor of which the windows are located; and
         C.   One of the following: projecting sign, hanging sign or flag sign;
and
         D.   One of the following: sculptural feature sign or sandwich board
sign; and
         E.   One street address sign; and
         F.   One dedication sign; and
         G.   One incidental sign; and
         H.   One interpretive sign; and
         I.   Two of the following: building sign, building directory sign,
and/or directional signs (not to exceed four directional signs per lot); and
         J.   One yard sign, except when in accordance with Section
1486.12(b) or Section
1486.14.
      (2)   Within the C-1 Local Business District, a ground floor business
establishment located on a corner lot may have:
         A.   One of the following per each street frontage: wall sign, awning
sign, combination of wall sign and awning sign; or
         B.   One marquee sign; and
         C.   Window signs whose coverage do not exceed 15% of the total window
area on the floor of which the windows are located; and
         D.   One of the following per each street frontage: projecting sign,
hanging sign or flag sign; and
         E.   One of the following per each street frontage: sculptural feature
sign or sandwich board sign; and
         F.   One street address sign; and
         G.   One dedication sign; and
         H.   One incidental sign; and
         I.   One interpretive sign; and
         J.   One of each of the following per each street frontage: building
sign, building directory sign, and/or directional signs (not to exceed four
directional signs per lot); and
         K.    Two yard signs, except when in accordance with Section
1486.12(b) or Section
1486.14.
      (3)   Within the C-1 Local Business District, a non-ground floor business
establishment may have:
         A.   One window sign per tenant whose graphic area does not exceed 15%
of any one tenant’s window, and one window sign located on the window of the
tenant’s ground-floor entry door whose graphic area does not exceed 15% of the
window area.
         B.   One projecting sign.
      (4)   Within the C-a Local Business District, a non-ground floor business
establishment located on a corner lot may have:
         A.   One window sign per tenant whose graphic area does not exceed 15%
of any one tenant’s window, and one window sign located on the window of the
tenant’s ground-floor entry door whose graphic area does not exceed 15% of the
window area.
         B.   One projecting sign per each street frontage.
   (b)   C-2 Downtown Business District. (See also Section
1266.04  of the Ellwood City Borough Zoning Ordinance).
      (1)   Within the C-2 Downtown Business District, a ground-floor business
establishment may have:
         A.   One of the following: wall sign, awning sign, combination of wall
sign and awning sign, or marquee sign; and
         B.   Window signs whose coverage do not exceed 15% of the total window
area on the floor of which the windows are located; and
         C.   One of the following: projecting sign or flag sign; and
         D.   One of the following: sculptural feature sign or sandwich board
sign; and
         E.   One street address sign; and
         F.   One dedication sign; and
         G.   One incidental sign; and
         H.   One interpretive sign; and
         I.   Two of the following: building sign, building directory sign,
and/or directional signs (not to exceed four directional signs per lot); and
         J.   One yard sign, except when in accordance with Section
1486.12(b) or Section
1486.14.
      (2)   Within the C-2 Downtown Business District, a ground-floor business
establishment located on a corner lot may have:
         A.   One of the following per each street frontage: wall sign, awning
sign, combination of wall sign and awning sign; or
         B.   One or marquee sign; and
         C.   Window signs whose coverage do not exceed 15% of the total window
area on the floor of which the windows are located; and
         D.   One of the following per each street frontage: projecting sign or
flag sign; and
         E.   One of the following per each street frontage: sculptural feature
sign or sandwich board sign; and
         F.   One street address sign; and
         G.   One dedication sign; and
         H.   One incidental sign; and
         I.   One interpretive sign; and
         J.   One of each of the following per each street frontage: building

1486.08   PUBLIC SAFETY.
   (a)   No sign may be located so that it interferes with the view necessary
for motorists to proceed safely through intersections or to enter onto or exit
from public streets or private roads.
   (b)   Signs that revolve or are animated or that utilize movement or
apparent movement to attract the attention of the public are prohibited.
   (c)   No sign may be erected so that by its location, color, size, shape,
nature or message may obstruct the view of or be confused with official traffic
signs or other signs erected by governmental agencies.
   (d)   Temporary signs and sandwich board signs must be made of weather-
proof, sturdy material that will not easily blow away or collapse and
potentially cause harm to citizens.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.09   LANDSCAPING.
   (a)   Ground Signs.
      (1)   For each visible face, the landowner and/or developer shall provide
landscaping equivalent to one and one-half square feet for each square foot of
sign area (both faces), located at the base of the sign structure. Landscaping
shall consist of a combination of deciduous and evergreen ornamental grasses,
groundcover and/or small shrubs. Turf grasses shall not be considered as
landscaping for ground signs.
   (b)   Pole Signs.
      (1)    For each visible sign, the landowner and/or developer shall
provide landscaping equivalent to three square feet for each square foot of
sign area (both faces), located at the base of the sign structure. Landscaping
shall consist of a combination of deciduous and evergreen ornamental grasses,
groundcover and/or small shrubs. Turf grasses shall not be considered as
landscaping for pole signs.
   (c)   Billboard Signs.
      (1)   For each visible sign, the landowner and/or developer shall provide
landscaping equivalent to two square feet for each square foot of sign area
(both faces), located at the base of the sign structure, Landscaping shall
consist of a combination of deciduous and evergreen ornamental grasses,
groundcover and/or small shrubs. Turf grasses shall not be considered as
landscaping for pole signs.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.10   MATERIALS.
   (a)   Sign shall be made of high quality, highly durable materials that
complement the building and street of which they become part. The following
materials shall apply to signs:
      (1)   Nylon or other flexible synthetic materials are limited to only
temporary signs and blade signs.
      (2)   Any combination of the following materials may be used for a
permanent sign:
         A.   Wood.
         B.   Stone.
         C.   Brick.
         D.   Glass.
         E.   Metal.
         F.   Acrylic.
         G.   PVC.
         H.   Medium/High density overlay board.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.11   GENERAL ILLUMINATION REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   To preserve the existing character of the community, required external
lighting for signs shall be gooseneck lighting, panel lighting, and flood
lighting. Additional lighting options may be submitted to Borough Council for
approval.
   (b)   Internal Illumination and Internally Illuminated Signs.
      (1)   Internal illumination is permitted as a source of signage
illumination that is restricted to the numbers, letters, and associated symbols
of the sign. Internal illumination of the background, base, or non-letter,
numbers, or symbols of the sign is prohibited. The background/base material
shall be opaque and not allow for light to pass through the material.
Transparent materials which allow for light to pass through may not exceed 50%
of the total sign area.
      (2)   When a sign incorporates internally illuminated lettering, the face
of the letters shall be made of transparent materials but the non-face area of
the letters shall be made of opaque materials.
   (c)   No sign within 150 feet of a residential zone may be illuminated
between the hours of 12:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m.
   (d)   No sign shall contain or be illuminated by flashing or intermittent
lights or lights of changing degrees of intensity.
   (e)   If a sign is located beneath a residential dwelling on the second
story, then the lights shall be situated above the sign facing downwards, not
beneath the sign facing upwards.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.12   PROHIBITED SIGNS.
   (a)   Spinning signs are not permitted in any zoning district.
   (b)   During any political election, yard signs shall not be permitted on
any public property four weeks before and five days after of the voting date.
See also Section
1486.14.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.13   MAINTENANCE.
   (a)   Existing Signs. Any sign existing at the time of the approval of this
chapter and thereafter shall be subject to the following regulations:
      (1)   Any sign advertising a place of business or activity which
terminates operations shall be removed by the owner within 30 days of such
termination. Removal shall include all sign supports, brackets and lighting
conduits.
      (2)   If the Building Inspector shall find any sign, marquee, canopy or
awning to have been erected or maintained in violation of this chapter, written
notice shall be given to the owner of the conditions and actions required to be
in compliance. If, after 30 days from the date of such notice, corrections have
not been made, the owner shall be subject to summary proceedings, and the
Building Inspector may have the offending sign, marquee, canopy or awning
repaired or removed with the costs assessed to the owner.
   (b)   Removal of Nonconforming Signs. When a nonconforming sign is taken
down or moved for any reason, the same may not again be erected or
reestablished or permitted to remain at any location on the property without
the prior issuance of a sign permit, and in such case, no sign permit shall be
issued unless the sign is first made to conform to all regulations contained in
this chapter.
   (c)   Damaged or Destroyed Nonconforming Signs. A sign damaged, dilapidated
or destroyed by any means, to an extent of more than fifty percent of its
replacement cost at the time of destruction, shall not be reconstructed except
in conformity with the provisions of this chapter. The replacement cost will be
determined by the Building Inspector.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.14   YARD SIGN PERMIT GRACE-PERIOD.
   (a)   During any political election, whether local, State, or Federal, yard
signs may be erected without a permit for up to four weeks prior to and five
days following the voting date of the said political election.
   (b)   All yard signs during this grace-period shall comply with the
appropriate dimensional standards, granted the sign or signs do not conflict
with public safety, as per Section
1486.08 or any other county, State or Federal regulation.
   (c)   No limits on the number of yard signs during the grace-period shall be
imposed by the Borough; nor shall the Borough collect permit fees for yard
signs during the grace-period.
   (d)   Outside of this multi-week grace-period during any political election,
the standards and requirements of this chapter shall apply to yard signs,
including all permit requirements and fees. See also Section
1486.12(b).
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.15   PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE; CERTIFICATION.
   (a)   Application. A permit from the Building Inspector shall be required
before a sign of any kind can be erected, altered or enlarged, and for all
nonconforming signs. The application shall be accompanied by, but not limited
to, the following:
      (1)   A statement of permission granted by the owner of the property for
erection of the sign on said property, if the owner and applicant are not the
same.
      (2)   The location of the sign on the property relative to buildings and
property lines and driveways.
      (3)   A copy of the drawing from which the contractor will create and
erect or alter the sign.
   (b)   Fees. The fee for sign permits shall be established from time to time
by resolution of Council.
   (c)   Certification. Every sign in the Borough shall be licensed and/or
certified at the time the permit is issued. (See Section
1486.17 .)
   (d)   Duration. The duration of a sign permit shall be in accordance with
the permit requirements on file at the Borough Municipal Building.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.16   PERMIT EXEMPTION.
   (a)   The following signs shall be exempt from the provisions of this
chapter:
      (1)   Street, traffic, public safety, public parking, hospital and school
signs and signs providing directions to Business Districts.
      (2)   Any sign required by Federal or State statutes and regulations
regarding public utilities and their operations.
      (3)   Yard signs in accordance with Section1486.14.
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.17   DIMENSIONAL MODIFICATIONS.
   (a)   If the limitations contained herein obstruct or hinder the visibility
of a sign, an applicant may request a dimensional modification with the
Building Inspector by submitting an application and paying the non-refundable
associated fee on file at the Borough Municipal Building.
   (b)   Upon receiving the application, Borough Council shall provide the
opportunity at their regularly scheduled meeting for the applicant to express
their rationale for the modification and demonstrate that the modification does
not create any public safety hazards or change the character of the
neighborhood. Upon this meeting discussion, Borough Council shall grant or deny
the dimensional modification within 45 days.
(Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.18   LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION.
   (a)   Registration. Upon adoption of this chapter, and during January each
year thereafter, every business and/or person within the Borough owning a sign
shall register the sign with the Building Inspector in order to receive
certification of compliance (a sign license).
      (1)   Every sign owner will be required to pay a licensing fee for each
sign of ownership;
      (2)   At the time of licensing, all projecting signs which protrude over
the public right of way and all free-standing signs that are and have been
erected within 20 feet from the public right will be required to carry
liability insurance and receive a certificate of compliance.
      (3)   The sign owner will have fifteen days from receipt of notice to
provide proof of such insurance to the Building Inspector.
      (4)   It is also required for the sign owner to sign the liability form
which stipulates proof of said liability insurance on an annual basis. Such
form shall be provided by the Building Inspector.
      (5)   It will be the responsibility of the Building Inspector to annually
inspect all signs within the Borough and to record proof of liability of
designated signs.
      (6)   Licensing and certification fees will be established from time to
time by resolution of Council.
   (b)   Example of Liability Insurance Form.
      I, the undersigned, on this _____ day of _____________, 20___, hereby
agree to provide liability insurance in the amount of $__________for the sign
located at ___________, Ellwood City, PA. The insurance policy will state that
the Borough will not be held legally responsible for any damage done to any
persons or property. I understand that it is my responsibility to provide a
record of the insurance to the Building Inspector on an annual basis.
                              _____________________________
                              Signature
                              _____________________________
                              Please print name
                              _____________________________
                              Building Inspector
(Ord. 2159. Passed 12-19-94. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.19   SIGNS, BANNERS AND ADVERTISING MATTER OVER STREETS, ALLEYS AND
HIGHWAYS.
   (a)   Adoption of Policy and Procedure. The following Borough policy and
procedure shall be followed for granting written consent for the installation
of signs, banners or advertising matter over streets, alleys or highways in the
Borough.
   (b)   Consent of Council Required. No person shall place any sign, banner or
advertising matter of any kind whatsoever on or across any street, alley or
highway in the Borough, or on or across any structure within the legal limits
of any Borough street, alley or highway, without first having obtained the
consent of Council therefor. Such consent shall be given only by a resolution
of Council.
   (c)   Conditions for Granting Requests. Requests for installation of the
devices provided for in subsection (b) hereof will be given consideration only
if:
      (1)   The request is made by letter from the responsible party.
      (2)   The message on the sign or banner relates to a national, State,
regional or local function or charitable affair and not more than 20% of the
message on the sign or banner relates to naming and/or advertising a commercial
project, enterprise, business or company that is sponsoring the event and/or
the banner installation.
   (d)   Information on Requests. The official request shall contain the
following information:
      (1)   A description of the device to be used (sign, banner, etc.),
including the size of the device (length and width), any message on the device
and the vertical clearance from the pavement to the lowest part of the device.
      (2)   The location where the device is to be erected.
      (3)   The approximate date of installation and removal of the device.
      (4)   A statement that the requesting party assumes full responsibility
for erecting, maintaining and removing the device and for any liability that
might result therefrom.
   (e)   Obtaining Request Forms. Requests forms must be obtained at the office
of the Borough Secretary 45 days prior to the date of installation.
   (f)   Declaration of Nuisance. Any such sign, banner or advertising matter,
as provided for in this section, which are placed without the consent of the
Borough shall be declared to be a public nuisance and may be abated by the
Borough with or without notice to the person responsible for the placing of
such sign, banner or advertising matter.
   (g)   Exceptions. Council does hereby except from this section a certain
sign located on Fifth Street, approximately 20 feet south of its intersection
with Lawrence Avenue, which sign now displays the name of the Borough, and any
sign which may hereafter replace the aforesaid sign, if it is approved by
Council.
   (h)   Placement Across State Highways or Roads. Persons wishing to place a
sign or banner across State highways or roads must comply with Section 211.10
of Title 67, Pa. Code, as amended.
(Ord. 2067. Passed 5-21-90. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
1486.20   PLACING OF CERTAIN SIGNS AND ADVERTISING MATERIALS PROHIBITED.
   (a)   No person, persons, partnership, corporation, or any other entity,
shall place, affix, or attach to any utility pole, sign pole, or refuse
receptacle owned by the Borough, any sign, banner or advertising material.
Utility poles that are subject to this section shall include electric,
telephone, street light poles or standard directional sign poles, and/or poles
holding traffic signs or lights.
   (b)   The following signs shall not be included in the above restriction:
hospital signs, route signs, no parking signs, street signs and snow removal
signs.
   (c)   Any person, persons, partnership, corporation, or any other entity
found guilty of such a violation shall be fined twenty-five dollars ($25.00)
plus costs, as a penalty for violating the provisions of this section.
(Ord. 2371. Passed 10-18-05. Ord. 2534. Passed 5-15-17.)
CHAPTER 1488
Storm Water Management
